text: "Holy Cow" is a song written by Allen Toussaint and performed by Lee Dorsey. It reached #6 on the UK Singles Chart, #10 on the U.S. R&B; chart, and #23 on the U.S. pop chart in 1966. It was featured on his 1966 album Working in the Coal Mine - Holy Cow. The song was arranged Allen Toussaint and produced by Toussaint and Marshall Sehorn. ==Other versions== *Buddy Lucas released a version of the song on his 1967 album Honkin' Sax. *The Shadows released a version of the song on their 1967 album From Hank, Bruce, Brian and John. *The Band released a version of the song on their 1973 album Moondog Matinee. *Mike Finnigan released a version of the song on his 1976 album Mike Finnigan. *Kingfish released a version of the song their 1985 album Alive in Eighty Five. *Oily Rags released a version of the song on their 1985 album Oily Rags. *Jools Holland released a version of the song as a single in 1990, but it did not chart. ==References== Category:1966 songs Category:1966 singles Category:1990 singles Category:Songs written by Allen Toussaint Category:Lee Dorsey songs Category:The Shadows songs Category:The Band songs Category:Chas & Dave songs Category:I.R.S. Records singles
title: Holy Cow (Lee Dorsey song)
